title: How to Delete Your Browsing History in Google Chrome

steps.title: Click ⋮ in the upper-right corner of the window.
steps.content: Click ⋮ in the upper-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Clear Browsing Data….
steps.content: Click Clear Browsing Data… . A window will open that offers options for "Basic" browser history clearing. If you want even more options, you can click Advanced at the top right to select from a list of options to delete.

steps.title: Click the ▾ drop-down arrow.
steps.content: Click the ▾ drop-down arrow. It's next to "Time range" at the top of the dialog box.

steps.title: Select All time.
steps.content: Select All time . This will ensure all of your browser history is deleted and not just your recent history.

steps.title: Check "Browsing history."
steps.content: Check "Browsing history." A checkmark will appear next to "Browsing history" when it is selected. Uncheck anything else you don't want to delete. If you want to delete your cookies and cache, too, you can select them.

steps.title: Click CLEAR BROWSING DATA.
steps.content: Click CLEAR BROWSING DATA . The specified browsing history will be deleted.

steps.title: Tap the three dots menu.
steps.content: Tap the three dots menu. It's either in the top right or lower right corner of the window.

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data….
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data… . It will be at the top or the bottom of the screen, depending on your device and operating system.

steps.title: Tap "Browsing history."
steps.content: Tap "Browsing history." A checkmark will appear next to "Browsing history" when it is selected. On Android, tap the ▾ drop-down arrow at the top of the page and select All time . This will ensure all of the recorded browsing history is deleted, not just the recent browsing history. Uncheck anything else you don't want to delete.

steps.title: Tap Clear Browsing Data.
steps.content: Tap Clear Browsing Data . The specified browsing history will be deleted. On Android, the button is labeled CLEAR DATA . On iPhone you'll need to tap Clear Browsing Data again to confirm deletion.
